abstract: Abu Zubaydah, terrorism suspect held in American custody for 14 years and first detainee to be waterboarded, appears on video feed from Guantanamo Bay prison to appeal to Periodic Review Board for his release; appearance marks first time Zubaydah, who has been held without charges, has been seen by anyone besides Guantanamo officials during his imprisonment; Zubaydah insists he has no desire to harm United States or any other nation, but Defense Dept says he likely still has 'extremist mind-set.'
lead_paragraph: At a hearing, Mr. Zubaydah, who has been held for 14 years and was tortured by the C.I.A., said he posed no threat.
snippet: At a hearing, Mr. Zubaydah, who has been held for 14 years and was tortured by the C.I.A., said he posed no threat....

headline.main: Abu Zubaydah, Tortured Guantánamo Detainee, Makes Case for Release
headline.print_headline: Waterboarded, He Now Makes Case to Go Free
